NONPROFIT CLOUD
Enable and Configure Timelines for Programs and Benefits

Use the Timeline component to track activities related to a program, participant, or benefit on a chronological, intuitive, and visual timeline.

On a timeline, users can see data from objects as a sequence of events that happen over time. You determine what information shows on the timeline by choosing the base (or primary) object and the related objects. You can use standard objects or custom objects.

For example, you can configure a timeline for program managers to view all disbursements (benefit disbursement object) for a program participant (program enrollment object). You can configure the timeline to show the attendance status. Program managers can review the timeline to know whether a participant attended the program. If there is any discrepancy in the attendance status or disbursement data, they can investigate further by contacting the participants or service providers.

A user's permissions determine access to timelines. You can assign a user multiple timeline configurations. For example, a user can have access to timelines that represent program enrollment and benefit disbursement data.

Before you configure a timeline, identify your requirements. At a minimum, decide which objects are required for the timeline and the information that you want the timeline to show.

Set Up a Timeline
Enable the timeline component and then create or configure a timeline as per your requirements. You can select the fields to show for each timeline entry, and even show fields from other related objects and custom objects.
Display Timeline on a Record Page
To let your Program Management users see the timeline and its data, add it to a relevant Lightning record page. You can add multiple timelines to a page. For example, you can create separate timelines to show information about program enrollments, benefit disbursements, and attendance, and add them to a page.
